alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Nye County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 5:09PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Nye County through 545 PM PDT... At 507 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles west of Duckwater. This storm was nearly stationary. Torrential rainfall, especially in mountainous terrain, may create localized areas of flooding. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Nye County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
